New Records: Shami is the leading wicket-taker for India in World Cups, going past Zaheer Khan and Javagal Srinath's tally of 44 each.
Key Match Events: Shami took 5 wickets for 18, his personal best in ODIs.
Rohit Sharma scored 88, bringing up his 1000th ODI run of the year.
Shubman Gill scored 92, falling to a slower ball from Madushanka.
India won by 302 runs, their largest margin of victory in ODIs.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka head coach Chris Silverwood said the defeat in the Asia Cup final would give his side some motivation 'to come out and fight, show plenty of spirit and get stuck into the Indian side'.
Rohit Sharma mentioned that there will be some assistance for bowlers at the start and then at night, it will be nice for their seamers to bowl.
Post-Match Reflections: Shami's figures at the moment: 2.1-1-1-4. Reminds me of Courtney Walsh's 5 for 1 in the 1986 Champions Trophy, coincidentally also against Sri Lanka.
The lowest all-out total in ODIs is 35, by Zimbabwe (vs SL) and USA (vs Nepal). Sri Lanka 22/7 after 12.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Madushanka's 5-wicket haul is his maiden in ODIs but it's an expensive one as he ended up giving away 80 from his eight overs.
Shami's record five-for in ODIs, the most by an Indian with three of them coming in the World Cups, the joint-most with Mitchell Starc.
Sri Lanka's lowest ODI total is 50, which came against India in the Asia Cup final this year.
Others: Kusal Mendis, Sri Lanka's most consistent batter in this World Cup, fell for a duck.
Sri Lanka's players will wear black armbands to pay tribute to Percy Abeysekera, the legendary cheerleader who died earlier this week.
